name: amorphophallus
edibility: Some types have edible corms that are used to make noodles and jellies and as a thickening agent. The leaf and stalk can also be eaten of some of the plants
light: Dappled Sunlight (Shade through upper canopy all day)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
fruit-description: Soft fleshy round berries are form of various size and colors
flower-description: The small individual flowers are male at the top of the spadix and female on the lower part. The spadix varies in size and color depending on the variety.
leaf-description: Most produce a single compound pinnate leaf of various sizes and colors can range from green to nearly black.
stem-description: The single stem can be small to large and trunk-like
uses: The cooked corms have various traditional medicinal uses.
